intro: Amphitecna isthmica, commonly known as the Isthmian orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and a single, showy flower with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination. Amphitecna isthmica is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions to thrive.
